data.title: Denise Elizabeth Noonan OBITUARY
data.meta_description: Denise Elizabeth Noonan - November 21, 1969 - June 4, 2024,"Though I walk through the valley of the shadow of death, I will fear no evil, for You are with m
data.text: Denise Elizabeth Noonan – November 21, 1969 – June 4, 2024,”Though I walk through the valley of the shadow of death, I will fear no evil, for You are with me.” (Psalm 23:4)It is with deep sadness that we announce the passing of Denise Elizabeth Noonan on June 4, 2024, at the age of 54. Denise was born on November 21, 1969, and was the beloved first child and daughter of Elizabeth F. Ferro (Horton) and the late Dennis Noonan, and stepfather Arthur Ferro.Denise is survived by her mother, Elizabeth F. Ferro, her aunt Sandra Reinhard, and her siblings Andrea Ferro Barnhart, Donna, Susan, and Dennis Noonan. She leaves behind her eight children: Michael Thomason (Nicole), Destiny Ferro, Danielle Williamson (Willis), Dionna Ferro, Angelique Ferro, Joshua Burris, Cole Burris, and Everlena Ferro. She is also survived by her beloved grandchildren: Khloe, Madelyn, Gabriel, Kaisley, and Carter.Denise was attending Ulster County Community College, majoring in accounting. Her perseverance and dedication toward self-improvement were admired by her friends and family.Denise is now at peace and reunited with her beloved grandmother, Elsie May Horton. Her spirit soars with the angels, and she is surrounded by the glory of God, where her soul finds eternal rest.A wake will be held Monday June 10 at the George J. Moylan Funeral Home Inc., 2053 Route 32 in Rosendale, New York, open to friends and family to pay their respects between 11 AM and 1 PM. (www.GJMoylanFuneralHome.com)A service will be held in her honor at 1 PM following the visitation. Rev. Kevin Malick will officiate. Denise’s final resting place will be at Montrepose Cemetery in Kingston, New York.Her passing is a significant loss to all who knew and loved her. We pray that Denise finds eternal peace with Almighty God and that her family and friends find solace in the memories they shared with her.In lieu of flowers, donations can be made to Catholic Charities of Ulster County, Kingston, NY.
